original: Hägg, Arvid, fd. kommendör, Katt-liammarsvik, f. 12/11/75 i Sthlm .av konteramiral Jacob H. o. Ellen Tel-lander. G. 1. 05 m. Lotten Haililing, d. 23; 2. 25 m. Elsa Öbrink. Barn: Christer f. 06, g. m. Thelma Garr, Rutger 12, g. m. Birgitta Hamxmar, Gösta (adopt :son) 19, g. m. Gurli Svensson, Magnus 28. — KSS 90-96, KSHS 012-04. Und:löjtn. 96, löjtn. 00, kapten 05, kommen dör kap t. av 2. gr. 17, av 1. gr. 19, kommendör i marinen 26. Adjut. i sjöförsv :dep. kom-mandoexp. 10-14, tjg. i marinstab. 14-19, e. led. av lotsstyr. 13-19, lär. v. KSHS 15-23, chef f. sjömanskår. skolor v. flottans station i Sthlm 20-29 o. f. und:off:- o. sjömanskårerna, be-väringsbefälh. v. flott, station i Sthlm 26-30. Led. av krigshovr. 36-42, långres. m. Balder t. Medelhav. 99-00, ledare av arb. m. flottans heml. farledssystem, divxhef f. torpedbåtsdiv., chef å jagare 14-15, chef å Dristigheten 19-20, å Drottn. Victoria 22-23, å Fylgia und. långresa t. Medelhav, o. Svarta hav. 25-26, sakk. i komm. f. omarb. av skolregl. f. flottans mansk. 06-07, sakk. i komm. f. omarb. av gäll. förordn. ang. lotsv. 18-20. Skr.: lärob. i artilleri f. flottans und :befälssk., beskrivn. å flottans avståndsmät. o. distanskikare m. m., red. f. tidskr. Underrättelser för sjöfarande 32-41. RSO, RVO, StOffTunNI, OffFrSvSO, RItS:tMLO, RRS:tA03kl, Sv. liv-räddn:sällsk. GM, LKrVA, LÖS.
translated: Hägg, Arvid, former commander, Katt-liammarsvik, born on November 12, 1875 in Stockholm, son of Rear Admiral Jacob H. and Ellen Tel-lander. Married 1st in 1905 to Lotten Haililing, who died in 1923; 2nd in 1925 to Elsa Öbrink. Children: Christer (born 1906), married to Thelma Garr, Rutger (born 1912), married to Birgitta Hamxmar, Gösta (adopted son, born 1919), married to Gurli Svensson, Magnus (born 1928). — KSS 90-96, KSHS 012-04. Second Lieutenant 1896, Lieutenant 1900, Captain 1905, Commander Captain of 2nd grade 1917, of 1st grade 1919, Commander in the Navy 1926. Adjutant in the Naval Defense Department, Commanding Officer 1910-1914, served in the Naval Staff 1914-1919, junior member of the Pilotage Authority 1913-1919, teacher at KSHS 1915-1923, commander of naval cadet schools on the fleet's station in Stockholm 1920-1929 and commanding officer of officers and naval cadets, commander of naval station in Stockholm, 1926-1930. Member of the War Court 1936-1942, on a voyage with Balder to the Mediterranean in 1899-1900, leader of the work with the Navy's secret fairways system, division commander of the torpedo boat division, commander of the destroyer 1914-1915, commander of Dristigheten 1919-1920, of Drottning Victoria 1922-1923, of Fylgia on a long trip to the Mediterranean and Black Sea 1925-1926, advisor on committee for revision of school rules for the Navy's enlisted personnel 1906-1907, advisor on committee for revision of existing ordinances regarding pilotage 1918-1920. Writings: textbook in artillery for the Navy's officer cadet schools, description of the Navy's range finders and distance binoculars, editor of the magazine "Underrättelser för sjöfarande" (Intelligence for Seafarers) 1932-1941. RSO, RVO, StOffTunNI, OffFrSvSO, RItS: tMLO, RRS: tA03kl, Swedish Life-saving Society GM, LKrVA, LÖS.
